name: aws-sagemaker
label: AWS SageMaker
description: AWS SageMaker helps data scientists and developers to prepare, build, train, and deploy high-quality machine learning (ML) models quickly by bringing together a broad set of capabilities purpose-built for ML.

fields.title: Configuration Type
fields.name: config_type
fields.description: Type of configuration using which you will provide credentials to access AWS SageMaker and perform automated actions. You can choose between IAM Role or Access Credentials.If you choose 'IAM Role', then in the AWS Instance IAM Role field enter the IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services.If you choose 'Access Credentials', then you must enter the following details: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS SageMaker Access Key ID: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services.AWS Secret Access Key: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.

IAM Role.title: AWS Instance IAM Role
IAM Role.name: aws_iam_role
IAM Role.tooltip: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services.
IAM Role.description: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Region
Access Credentials.name: aws_region
Access Credentials.tooltip: AWS region of your account to access the AWS SageMaker
Access Credentials.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS SageMaker

Access Credentials.title: AWS Access Key ID
Access Credentials.name: aws_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services

Access Credentials.title: AWS Secret Access Key
Access Credentials.name: aws_secret_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate is to be verified or not.By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Get Actions
operations.description: Lists the actions in your account and their properties.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified Access Credentials as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, i.e., set it to 'True' then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS SageMaker Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS SageMaker

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Source URI
parameters.name: SourceUri
parameters.tooltip: A filter that returns only actions with the specified source URI.
parameters.description: A filter that returns only actions with the specified source URI.

parameters.title: Action Type
parameters.name: ActionType
parameters.tooltip: A filter that returns only actions of the specified type.
parameters.description: A filter that returns only actions of the specified type.

parameters.title: Created After
parameters.name: CreatedAfter
parameters.tooltip: A filter that returns only actions created on or after the specified time
parameters.description: A filter that returns only actions created on or after the specified time

parameters.title: Created Before
parameters.name: CreatedBefore
parameters.tooltip: A filter that returns only actions created on or before the specified time
parameters.description: A filter that returns only actions created on or before the specified time

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: SortBy
parameters.tooltip: The property used to sort results. The default value is CreationTime
parameters.description: The property used to sort results. The default value is CreationTime

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: SortOrder
parameters.tooltip: The sort order. The default value is Descending .
parameters.description: The sort order. The default value is Descending .

parameters.title: Next Token
parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.tooltip: If the previous call to ListActions didn't return the full set of actions, the call returns a token for getting the next set of actions.
parameters.description: If the previous call to ListActions didn't return the full set of actions, the call returns a token for getting the next set of actions.

parameters.title: Max Results
parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.tooltip: The maximum number of actions to return in the response. The default value is 10.
parameters.description: The maximum number of actions to return in the response. The default value is 10.

operations.title: Get Algorithms
operations.description: Lists the machine learning algorithms that have been created.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified Access Credentials as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, i.e., set it to 'True' then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS SageMaker Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS SageMaker

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Creation Time After
parameters.name: CreationTimeAfter
parameters.tooltip: A filter that returns only algorithms created after the specified time (timestamp)
parameters.description: A filter that returns only algorithms created after the specified time (timestamp)

parameters.title: Creation Time Before
parameters.name: CreationTimeBefore
parameters.tooltip: A filter that returns only algorithms created before the specified time (timestamp)
parameters.description: A filter that returns only algorithms created before the specified time (timestamp)

parameters.title: Name Contains
parameters.name: NameContains
parameters.tooltip: A string in the algorithm name. This filter returns only algorithms whose name contains the specified string.
parameters.description: A string in the algorithm name. This filter returns only algorithms whose name contains the specified string.

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: SortBy
parameters.tooltip: The property used to sort results. The default value is CreationTime
parameters.description: The property used to sort results. The default value is CreationTime

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: SortOrder
parameters.tooltip: The sort order. The default value is Ascending .
parameters.description: The sort order. The default value is Ascending .

parameters.title: Max Results
parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.tooltip: The maximum number of algorithms to return in the response.
parameters.description: The maximum number of algorithms to return in the response.

parameters.title: Next Token
parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.tooltip: If the response to a previous ListAlgorithms request was truncated, the response includes a NextToken . To retrieve the next set of algorithms, use the token in the next request.
parameters.description: If the response to a previous ListAlgorithms request was truncated, the response includes a NextToken . To retrieve the next set of algorithms, use the token in the next request.

operations.title: Get Applications
operations.description: Lists application from aws sagemaker server based on input parameters you have provided

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified Access Credentials as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, i.e., set it to 'True' then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS SageMaker Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS SageMaker

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Max Results
parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.tooltip: Returns a list up to a specified limit.
parameters.description: Returns a list up to a specified limit.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: SortOrder
parameters.tooltip: The sort order for the results. The default is Ascending.
parameters.description: The sort order for the results. The default is Ascending.

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: SortBy
parameters.tooltip: The parameter by which to sort the results. The default is CreationTime.
parameters.description: The parameter by which to sort the results. The default is CreationTime.

parameters.title: Domain ID Equals
parameters.name: DomainIdEquals
parameters.tooltip: A parameter to search for the domain ID.
parameters.description: A parameter to search for the domain ID.

parameters.title: User Profile Name Equals
parameters.name: UserProfileNameEquals
parameters.tooltip: A parameter to search by user profile name
parameters.description: A parameter to search by user profile name

parameters.title: Next Token
parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.tooltip: If the previous response was truncated, you will receive this token. Use it in your next request to receive the next set of results
parameters.description: If the previous response was truncated, you will receive this token. Use it in your next request to receive the next set of results
